summary: The document is a secret communication from May 1978, related to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It mentions the planned visit of two staff members from the House Select Committee on Assassinations to Guayaquil and Caracas, without detailing the purpose of their visit. The communication seeks to confirm whether the host is aware of and should expect contact from these individuals.
key_findings: The document is part of the records related to the investigation of President John F. Kennedy's assassination.
It highlights international aspects of the investigation, with staff members traveling to Guayaquil and Caracas.
The purpose of the visit by the committee staff members is not disclosed in the document.
The communication is marked as secret, indicating the sensitive nature of the information.
